forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. West southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 2 to 7 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening settles over Downtown San Francisco, the air is tinged with a crisp coolness, the kind that reminds us that winter still holds sway in this vibrant city. Tonight, the skies remain partly cloudy, casting soft shadows and allowing the twinkling city lights to shine like distant stars. With temperatures dipping to around 47 degrees and a gentle west-southwest breeze whispering gently through the streets, it seems like an excellent evening for a quiet stroll along the Embarcadero, where the lights of the Bay Bridge shimmer against the dark waters, their reflections creating a tableau of soothing beauty.

Looking ahead to Saturday, the promise of a mostly sunny day beckons. With a high reaching near 63 degrees, the sun will gradually unveil the city, though cooler afternoon temperatures will gracefully diminish to around 59. Such weather invites a casual Saturday brunch at a favorite café, followed by a leisurely exploration of the local art scene or perhaps a stroll through Golden Gate Park, where the first blooms of spring are beginning to flirt with the still-chill air. Dressing in layers will be wise—perhaps a light sweater beneath a stylish jacket will keep you comfortable as you transition from the cool morning air to the anticipated warmth of the sun. For those seeking a tapestry of color and activity, this weekend’s weather offers a delightful opportunity to enjoy the simple pleasures of life in the city.
